coding_practice.title: Minimum Moves to Equal Array Elements
coding_practice.description:
Given an integer array nums of size n, return the minimum number of moves required to make all array elements equal.

In one move, you can increment n - 1 elements of the array by 1.

examples.explanation: Only three moves are needed (remember each move increments two elements): [1,2,3] => [2,3,3] => [3,4,3] => [4,4,4]

coding_practice.constraints:
n == nums.length
1 <= nums.length <= 10^5
-10^9 <= nums[i] <= 10^9
The answer is guaranteed to fit in a 32-bit integer.
coding_practice.explanation:
1. 注意到每次增加 n-1 個元素相當於減少最大元素以外的元素。
2. 計算總和 sum(nums) 減去最小值乘以元素個數 min(nums) * len(nums)，即可得到最少移動次數。
